questions.question: One day people .............................. live on Mars.
questions.description: We use will be able to to talk about future ability.

questions.question: I am interested in ............................ to swim.
questions.description: We use a noun or an ing form after a preposition.

questions.question: You don't look happy .............................  me.
questions.description: The adjective happy is followed by a to-infinitive.

questions.question: That skirt is too short, ............................?
questions.description: We use a negative tag after an affirmative sentence.

questions.question: He was .............................. injured in the accident.
questions.description: Deadly is an adjective. It is used before a noun fatally is the adverb for this meaning.

questions.question: I very much enjoy .............................
questions.description: We use an ing form after enjoy.

questions.question: She wouldn't have survived, if they ................................... her to hospital.
questions.description: In the third conditional we use a past perfect tense in the if-clause and would have + past participle in the main clause.

questions.question: Alice didn't pass the test. Mary didn't .............................
questions.description: We can use 'not either' to add a negative idea to another negative idea.

questions.question: She often comes and ............................... the afternoon with us.
questions.description: Here the singular pronoun she is the subject of both clauses.

questions.question: We need as ................................ volunteers as possible.
questions.description: Before a plural noun we use many.

questions.question: Do you know the reason ................................ her unhappiness?
questions.description: Reason is followed by the preposition for.
